page.title: 19THE BURTON PIDSEA PLAYERS
page.content: The Burton Pidsea Players formed in September, 1979. The Players have to be over 17 years of age. At present there are 24 Players. The Players put on two major shows each year, a Spring Show and a Pantomime, plus additional entertainments for the local Darby and Joan Club and Church Concerts. They meet every Monday night at 8 p.m., usually in the Village Hall. Donations are given to charities and local causes from money raised from the annual carol singing. They hold a Jumble Sale around September or October to raise funds for the annual senior citizens' parcels, which are delivered in costume. This year's panto is to be the Wizard of Oz. Preparations began in July when the parts and scripts were given out.
